commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 4 leg byes 4 leg byes That's that! CSK's winning run against RCB at Fort Chepauk continues. There is a review, but more in desperation, I think. Aims for the yorker that hits Dube's pad and goes to the fine leg fence. Ball tracker confirms the ball pitched outside leg. Ruturaj Gaikwad has made a winning start to his captaincy tenure. See all photos
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, leg byes, FOUR, that'll do well enough for CSK! They get their 2024 campaign off to a winning start! Fired in full and at the boots, was just a touch down leg, Shivam Dube looked to flick it and missed, brushed his boot and went down fine to the fine-leg ropes

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube,  SIX runs SIX runs TONKED! There was some aggression from Dube on that six. Banged in short outside off. He unleashes the pull and sends the ball soaring over deep backward square leg.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, SIX, high and mighty! Banged in short on middle, there's only one thing coming at Shivam Dube and he knows what it is, he sits back comfortably and nails the hook high and over the long leg ropes

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, no run no run Banged in short now, good bumper this aiming at Dube's body. He is beaten for pace
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short on middle, Shivam Dube looks to take it on and misses, just went over the gloves, called one for the over

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, no run no run Banged in short now, good bumper this aiming at Dube's body. He is beaten for pace
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, full and just down leg, Shivam Dube looks to glance it fine and misses, will be a wide

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Goes fuller and down leg even as Dube was looking to back away. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short on middle, Shivam Dube looks to take it on and misses, just went over the gloves, called one for the over

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Goes fuller and down leg even as Dube was looking to back away. Called a wide.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, full and just down leg, Shivam Dube looks to glance it fine and misses, will be a wide

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball on off, he pulls to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length on leg-stump, pulled away to deep square leg

commentary: Siraj to Dube, no run no run Banged in short outside off, he misses the ramp again
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, no run, back of a length and slanting across outside off, Shivam Dube looks to slash it away and misses

commentary: Siraj to Dube, FOUR runs FOUR runs He gets another four to his name! Slower back of a length ball on off. He stands tall and flat-bats it over the bowler's head. Mid-off and mid-on were in
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, FOUR, lovely shot! RCB just adamant about bowling short here and they're paying for it, back of a length on middle, was pace off, Shivam Dube backed away to free his arms and slapped it back over the bowler, both mid-on and mid-off were up

commentary: Siraj to Dube, no run no run Low full toss outside off, he whacks it to extra cover. No run there
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, no run, low full-toss on off-stump, Shivam Dube finds cover with the drive

commentary: Siraj to Dube, no run no run Banged in short outside off, he misses his ramp as the ball goes to the keeper.
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, no run, slower short ball outside off, Shivam Dube looks to reach it and tap it down and misses

commentary: Siraj to Dube, FOUR runs FOUR runs Back of a length ball and he's found the gap to perfection. On leg stump, he gets across, and pulls it neatly in the gap between square leg and deep fine  leg
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, FOUR, 50-run stand comes up! This is just poor bowling, back of a length and on the hips, no one back at fine-leg and these are easy pickings for Dube as he tucks it away to the fine-leg fence

commentary: Siraj to Dube, no run no run Very high full toss, almost a waist-high no ball. It was on the stump and Dube can only bunt it to extra cover
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, no run, yorker goes horribly wrong but Siraj gets away with it, nearly a waist-high full-toss on middle, Shivam Dube was sitting back expecting a short one and he just bunted it towards cover

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball on off, he pushes it to long off for a run
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, good cricket again, good length delivery on off-stump, gently bunted towards mid-off for a quick single, even Faf isn't quick enough to stop the single

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 4 byes 4 byes Beats the batter, beats the keeper and CSK collect four byes! That was banged in short at pace outside off. Dube looks for a ramp, misses as the ball hurries to Rawat who leaps with both hands up. The ball clips the tip of his fingers and runs away. Looks like he has hurt his fingers as well. Out comes the physio.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, byes, FOUR, my my that went at pace! Back of a length on middle, this was bowled at full-throttle, Shivam Dube backed away a little looking to run it down but it whistled past his visor, kept rising on Anuj Rawat and he tipped it over with his fingertips as he leapt looking to stop it, RCB cannot afford these

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 4 byes 4 byes Beats the batter, beats the keeper and CSK collect four byes! That was banged in short at pace outside off. Dube looks for a ramp, misses as the ball hurries to Rawat who leaps with both hands up. The ball clips the tip of his fingers and runs away. Looks like he has hurt his fingers as well. Out comes the physio.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, banged in short and going over the batter's head, that's both short deliveries allowed being wasted in wides

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Another wayward bouncer down leg. Called a wide again
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, byes, FOUR, my my that went at pace! Back of a length on middle, this was bowled at full-throttle, Shivam Dube backed away a little looking to run it down but it whistled past his visor, kept rising on Anuj Rawat and he tipped it over with his fingertips as he leapt looking to stop it, RCB cannot afford these

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Another wayward bouncer down leg. Called a wide again
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, banged in short and going over the batter's head, that's both short deliveries allowed being wasted in wides

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, FOUR runs FOUR runs Oh, that's so neatly done by Dube. Back of a length ball on off. Dube stays leg side of the ball and just helps it past point. Used the pace of the ball much to his advantage
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, FOUR, expertly guided! RCB have telegraphed their intentions here, back of a length on off-stump, Shivam Dube hung back and stayed leg-side, let it come to him and just opened the face of the blade to steer it well to the left of third man

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, FOUR runs FOUR runs Oh, that's so neatly done by Dube. Back of a length ball on off. Dube stays leg side of the ball and just helps it past point. Used the pace of the ball much to his advantage
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, RCB seem to be going a little overboard with the short stuff, Alzarri Joseph bangs it far too short, that was never even going to be close to Dube

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Banged in short and again that is quite short outside. A wide is a result
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, FOUR, expertly guided! RCB have telegraphed their intentions here, back of a length on off-stump, Shivam Dube hung back and stayed leg-side, let it come to him and just opened the face of the blade to steer it well to the left of third man

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Banged in short and again that is quite short outside. A wide is a result
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, wide, RCB seem to be going a little overboard with the short stuff, Alzarri Joseph bangs it far too short, that was never even going to be close to Dube

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball outside off, he pulls it to deep midwicket
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja, 1 run, length delivery outside off, swatted down to long-on

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs Banged in short at pace hurrying Jadeja who mistimes his pull towards long on. But because he had completely miscued it, the bowler had to sprint across. They take two.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja, 2 runs, excellent running agian, back of a length on middle, rushes Jadeja on the pull and it dribbles towards mid-wicket, Joseph runs to it himself but they're so quick between the wickets to pinch that second

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs Back of a length ball outside off, he thrashes it away to deep point. Some confusion and the result is an over-throw. What happened is a throw was fired from the deep who hit direct at the striker's end. Rawat, meanwhile feels there is a chance of a run out at the non-striker's end. He lobs the ball, misses and there is no one backing up
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Jadeja, 2 runs, length delivery just outside off, cut away towards deep point. Oh dear, comedy of errors, the throw that came back in hit the stumps at the keeper's end and the keeper then had a shy at the stumps at the other end while the bowler had turned and was walking back to his mark

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Shimmies down the track and scythes the good length ball to deep cover
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 run, full and just outside off, carved out towards deep point

commentary: Green to Dube,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball on the stumps. He is on the backfoot as he gets a thick inside-edge back onto the pad and close to the stumps. They pinch a single
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, good length delivery on off-stump, Shivam Dube hung back looking to tuck it into the leg-side and got a thick inside edge onto the pads, it dribbled just off the surface and they pinch a single

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Shimmies down the track to the back of a length ball outside off and slaps it to deep point
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 run, length delivery just outside off, Jadeja charges at it and makes some room before slapping it down to sweeper cover

commentary: Green to Dube,  3 runs 3 runs Nicely done. Banged in short outside off, he stays still and ramps it in the gap to the right of deep point. The fielder gets across and saves a run. Oh, hang on...was Dagar in contact with the ropes there? On first replay , it seemed that way. Wasn't checked though
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 3 runs, very clever batting, back of a length and outside off, Shivam Dube hung back and just opened the face of the blade to steer it up and over backward point, man running across to his right did really well to stop it with a dive but just pushed it too far back in, they get a third

commentary: Green to Dube,  3 runs 3 runs Nicely done. Banged in short outside off, he stays still and ramps it in the gap to the right of deep point. The fielder gets across and saves a run. Oh, hang on...was Dagar in contact with the ropes there? On first replay , it seemed that way. Wasn't checked though
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, wide, banged in very short, that sailed over the batter and Shivam Dube is a fairly tall man

commentary: Green to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Another bouncer but this one is too short. Called a wide. One bouncer for the over as well.
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 3 runs, very clever batting, back of a length and outside off, Shivam Dube hung back and just opened the face of the blade to steer it up and over backward point, man running across to his right did really well to stop it with a dive but just pushed it too far back in, they get a third

commentary: Green to Dube, 1 wide 1 wide Another bouncer but this one is too short. Called a wide. One bouncer for the over as well.
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, wide, banged in very short, that sailed over the batter and Shivam Dube is a fairly tall man

commentary: Green to Dube, FOUR runs FOUR runs Finds the gap. Banged in short on the hips of Dube as he helps it and pierces the gap between deep backward square leg and fine leg.
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, FOUR, right into the gap! Back of a length and on the hips, this didn't rise much, Shivam Dube got inside the line and used the pace to pull it away right into the gap between deep backward square leg and long leg

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball just outside off, he works it with soft hands to wide long-on but only for a run
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 run, good length delivery on off-stump, tucked down towards mid-on gently, they thought of two but it wasn't on

commentary: Siraj to Dube, no run no run Slower short ball beats Dube all ends up. Was bowled at 131kph outside off. Dube is early into his pull with the ball going to Rawat on the bounce
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, no run, back of a length slower delivery, goes across and Shivam Dube is through his pull too early

commentary: Siraj to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Another short ball on Jadeja's hips that he pulls to Maxwell once more. They are doing it well, for now
second_commentary: Siraj to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length on middle, pulled down to deep square leg

commentary: Siraj to Dube,  1 run 1 run Another bouncer on middle. Dube controls his pull to the right of deep backward square leg for only a run this time around
second_commentary: Siraj to Shivam Dube, 1 run, back of a length on middle-off, doesn't rise and Shivam Dube crunches the pull towards deep square leg, can't beat Maxwell to his right though

commentary: Siraj to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Banged in short just outside off, he pulls it down and in control to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Siraj to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length on middle, pulled down to deep square leg

commentary: Siraj to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs Back of a length down leg, he helps it to Green at deep fine leg. A slight misfield and that is enough for Jadeja to steal a second
second_commentary: Siraj to Jadeja, 2 runs, too straight again, Siraj gets away with another, back of a length and just down leg, Jadeja got inside the line and pulled it very fine, long leg got around to cut it off but two more taken

commentary: Siraj to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs On a length on the pads of Jadeja who clips it to the right of deep square leg. The fielder does well to keep them down to two. Maxwell it was, who hared across
second_commentary: Siraj to Jadeja, 2 runs, full and on the pads, lovely looking whip into the leg-side towards deep mid-wicket, was very well timed and Maxwell had to be at the top of his game, stopped it with a slide to his right

commentary: Maxwell to Dube, no run no run Huge appeal for caught behind but think that went off the pad. Not out says the umpire. Pushed quicker down leg, he looks to work it fine, can't get a bat on it. And the ball flicks his pad through to the keeper.
second_commentary: Maxwell to Shivam Dube, no run, flatter delivery and just pushed down leg, Shivam Dube looked to glance it fine and there was a loud appeal for caught behind, umpire stood unmoved so it might've brushed thigh pad

commentary: Maxwell to Dube, no run no run Short and wide, he rocks back and hammers the cut but straight to point
second_commentary: Maxwell to Shivam Dube, no run, flatter delivery just outside off, Shivam Dube presses back and cuts, backward point does well to stop it after tumbling to his left

commentary: Maxwell to Dube, no run no run Flatter on leg stump, he stays back and bunts it back to Maxwell
second_commentary: Maxwell to Shivam Dube, no run, fired in flat on middle, knocked straight back to the bowler

commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Slower through the air on middle, he pushes to long-on
second_commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja, 1 run, full on middle, pushed down the ground to long on

commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja,  SIX runs SIX runs PUMPED!  Tossed up just on the middle. Jadeja jumps down, reaches the pitch of the ball and tonks him over long-on
second_commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja, SIX, in the slot and it goes the distance! Tossed up a little too full on off-stump, a real freebie and Jadeja smoked it over long-on with a clean swing of the blade

commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja, no run no run Floated on off stump, he looks to drive, gets a thick inside-edge back onto the pad
second_commentary: Maxwell to Jadeja, no run, tossed up full on off-stump, slides on with the arm and catches a thick inside edge onto the pads as Jadeja looks to drive it into the off-side

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  1 run 1 run Slower back of a length ball outside off. Was bowled at 126kph. Jadeja pulls it down and towards deep midwicket
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length on off-stump, pulled away towards deep mid-wicket

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs Goes fuller now well outside off, he leans into the drive to the left of deep cover. They get two.
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 2 runs, full outside off, driven out through to deep extra cover, decently timed but not enough to beat the sweeper running to his left

commentary: Green to Jadeja,  2 runs 2 runs Goes fuller now well outside off, he leans into the drive to the left of deep cover. They get two.
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, wide, excellent take from Anuj Rawat, very short on middle, sailed over Jadeja's head, Rawat timed his jump to perfection behind the stumps and kept it in

commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 wide 1 wide Another bouncer but this one is way too short. Rawat leaps and saves a few runs
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, 2 runs, full outside off, driven out through to deep extra cover, decently timed but not enough to beat the sweeper running to his left

commentary: Green to Jadeja, 1 wide 1 wide Another bouncer but this one is way too short. Rawat leaps and saves a few runs
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, wide, excellent take from Anuj Rawat, very short on middle, sailed over Jadeja's head, Rawat timed his jump to perfection behind the stumps and kept it in

commentary: Green to Jadeja, no run no run Length ball on off, he pushes towards point and was looking for a run. Is sent back.
second_commentary: Green to Jadeja, no run, good length delivery angling into the batter on off-stump, Jadeja has to get on his toes as he drops it into the off-side

commentary: Green to Mitchell, OUT OUT The short ball does the trick for Green! Banged in short outside off, Mitchell was looking to go over long-on. Does not get any power on the pull and Patidar makes no mistake at long-on. See all photos
second_commentary: Green to Mitchell, out Caught by Rajat Patidar!! The short-ball tactic finally pays off for RCB! Looks like RCB had a plan and they stuck with it. Banged into the deck on off-stump, Mitchell made a bit of room by backing away and looked to flat-bat this over long-on, didn't get nearly enough and it came off the top half. Went straight down Patidar's throat at long-on and another timely wicket for RCB. Mitchell c Rajat Patidar b Green 22(18) [6s-2]

commentary: Green to Dube,  1 run 1 run Another miscue and the ball falls in no-man's land. Banged in short just above his hip. He mistimes his pull completely but the balls falls around the vacant square leg area
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, in the air but safe! Again Green goes back of a length and into the body, cramps him for room as he looks to pull and lobs up, lands safely in the square leg region

commentary: Green to Dube, no run no run Loud, loud appeal as Dube looks for a pull and gets beaten. But the umpire is unmoved. Faf has asked for a review. Don't think there was any bat there, though. Bouncer just outside off. He eyes the pull, is late again on it. Rawat was absolutely certain there was an edge. But replays confirm there was a gap between bat and ball.
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, no run, nothing on UltraEdge, review lost! Banged into the deck and going across the batter again, was just outside off, rushed him with the pace and cramped him for room as he looked to pull, just about went over the top-edge, was extremely close but nothing on UltraEdge to RCB's plight

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell,  2 runs 2 runs Slower short of a length ball on off stump. Mitchell waits for it and pulls in the gap between midwicket and long-on. They scurry back for two
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell, 2 runs, pace off this time, back of a length and just outside off, Mitchell sat deep in his crease and waited for it before pulling it away towards deep mid-wicket, no timing again but it was in the gap, they shuffle back for two

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube,  1 run 1 run Another short ball on off stump. Dube, once more can't get a clean connection. Shanks it to deep square leg.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, back of a length on middle, mistimed pull goes towards square leg this time

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Joseph is rushing the batters for sure. Banged in short at 143.9kph. Mitchell is camped on the backfoot looking for the pull. But even then he can only miscue to long on
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell, 1 run, and again, the zippy pace of Alzarri Joseph rushes the batter, good length just outside off, Mitchell was waiting on the backfoot looking to heave it away again and mistimed it down to long-on

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube,  1 run 1 run Banged in short around off stump, Dube is late on the pull again and miscues towards deep midwicket
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, back of a length on middle, takes it on with a pull but is clearly rushed again, mistimes it and it goes towards deep mid-wicket

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball at 142kph on off stump. He goes on the backfoot but ends up bunting it towards long on
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Mitchell, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off, Mitchell was hanging back looking to heave it away, rushed him and went towards mid-on off the splice

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Dube,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball outside off, he cuts it to deep point
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Shivam Dube, 1 run, length delivery outside off, cut away towards deep backward point

commentary: Green to Dube,  1 run 1 run Flies away to deep third. Was a back of a length ball well outside off. He flashes at it and gets a thick outside edge down to deep third on the bounce.
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, good length delivery slanting across outside off, Shivam Dube flashed at it and got a thick outside edge, went down to third man who was placed quite fine

commentary: Green to Dube, no run no run Another short ball at pace! Banged in short at 133.6kph as Dube looks for a pull and misses. That looked quicker than 133kph to be honest
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, no run, banged in short and at good pace, rushes Shivam Dube as he looks to take it on and beats him, Anuj Rawat fumbles behind the stumps

commentary: Green to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Length on the pads of Mitchell who shuffles across and works him to deep backward square leg
second_commentary: Green to Mitchell, 1 run, good length delivery on middle, Mitchell shuffles across and tucks it away towards deep square leg

commentary: Green to Dube,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball outside off. He pulls it, not with too much control towards deep midwicket
second_commentary: Green to Shivam Dube, 1 run, back of a length and slanting across just outside off, Shivam Dube shafts the pull towards mid-wicket off the toe end

commentary: Green to Rahane, OUT OUT Excellent catch by Maxwell at square leg and Rahane's sprightly knock ends. Back of a length ball but the line was crucial here. It was outside off, which meant Rahane had to fetch it and he could not control his pull. Maxwell is a few steps in from the boundary. But he adjusts well, and takes a reverse-cupped catch over his head See all photos
second_commentary: Green to Rahane, out Caught by Maxwell!! Superb catch from Maxwell in the deep! Rahane perishes but he's done his job. Back of a length on middle-leg again, didn't rise as much though and Rahane was hanging back again, he just checked his pull this time and it went off the top half, was still traveling but Maxwell intercepted it on the deep backward square leg ropes. He was a few yards in but did brilliantly to run to his left and jump at the right second to reel it in. Much needed for RCB, just keeps the morale up. Rahane c Maxwell b Green 27(19) [6s-2]

commentary: Green to Rahane,  SIX runs SIX runs Hooked for a hug six! Back of a length ball on off stump, he gets across and pulls it with disdain over backward square leg's head
second_commentary: Green to Rahane, SIX, into the stands! Just back of a length on middle-leg, poor line again and Rahane seemingly was waiting for the short one, he was sitting back and pulled this away to the deep backward square leg with ease

commentary: Green to Rahane,  SIX runs SIX runs Hooked for a hug six! Back of a length ball on off stump, he gets across and pulls it with disdain over backward square leg's head
second_commentary: Green to Rahane, wide, good length delivery that just angles down leg, Rahane looked to glance it fine and missed, called a wide

commentary: Green to Rahane, 1 wide 1 wide Wide first up. Was a length ball but sprays it down leg.
second_commentary: Green to Rahane, SIX, into the stands! Just back of a length on middle-leg, poor line again and Rahane seemingly was waiting for the short one, he was sitting back and pulled this away to the deep backward square leg with ease

commentary: Green to Rahane, 1 wide 1 wide Wide first up. Was a length ball but sprays it down leg.
second_commentary: Green to Rahane, wide, good length delivery that just angles down leg, Rahane looked to glance it fine and missed, called a wide

commentary: Dagar to Rahane,  1 run 1 run Slightly short on middle stump, Rahane hangs back and pats it to long on for a run
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Rahane, 1 run, flatter delivery on middle, worked away to wide long-on

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Full outside off, he digs it to cover for a quick run
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, 1 run, fired in full outside off, Mitchell was looking for a big one and could only jam it out towards cover

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell, no run no run Keeps it quicker and on a length on middle. Mitchell can only mistime it back towards the bowler
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, no run, flatter delivery on middle, knocked back towards the bowler who hops to his right to stop it

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell, no run no run Flatter on middle stump, he defends
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, no run, full on off-stump, driven straight back to the bowler

commentary: Dagar to Rahane,  1 run 1 run Shimmies down the track and outside the line of leg stump, giving himself some room. Dagar adjust his length as Rahane drives to long off
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Rahane, 1 run, full and just outside off, Rahane makes room and skips down the track before slapping it down to long-off

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run On a length on middle and leg, he brings out the sweep past short fine leg
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, 1 run, full on off-stump, Mitchell leans right across his stumps and fetches it with a sweep, gets it to the left of short fine-leg but there's protection in the deep

commentary: Karn to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Very full once more on the stumps, he eases it to long on
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Mitchell, 1 run, full on middle, pushed down the ground to long on, good over for CSK, 15 off it

commentary: Karn to Rahane,  1 run 1 run A touch fuller on the stump, he pushes towards long-on. Was looking for a second but the fielder is quick on the ball
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up full on middle, gently worked away towards wide mid-on, only went to the edge of the ring and Rahane was looking for two but the man running in from long-on was quick

commentary: Karn to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run Dragged down on middle and leg, as Mitchell hangs back and works it to the on-side
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Mitchell, 1 run, length delivery on middle, Mitchell covers his stumps and works it away towards mid-wicket for one, good cricket

commentary: Karn to Mitchell,  SIX runs SIX runs This time over long off! Floated slower outside off, he goes over long off now. Such clean striking. Free swing of the blade from Mitchell
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Mitchell, SIX, two in a row! Tossed up full outside off, more than enough room for Mitchell to free his arms this time and he launches it over long-off, Karn Sharma under pressure

commentary: Karn to Mitchell,  SIX runs SIX runs Finally connect at one! Tossed up just a touch but that was right in Mitchell's arc. He extends his arm and swings it miles over long on
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Mitchell, SIX, Mitchell goes big! Floated up full on off-stump, this was in his zone and he cleared his front-leg and mowed it straight down the ground, cleared the ropes so easily

commentary: Karn to Mitchell, no run no run Darted quicker on off stump, he prods half-forward and pushes to cover
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Mitchell, no run, tossed up full on off-stump, Mitchell prods forward and knocks it towards cover

commentary: Dagar to Rahane, no run no run Pushes the length ball quicker on leg stump, Rahane goes back looking for a flick but misses and is rapped on the pad with the ball going down leg
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Rahane, no run, fired in quicker on a length, angles into the pads and skids through this time, beats Rahane who was looking to turn it into the leg-side and hits his pad, would've gone down leg

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell,  1 run 1 run A touch quicker outside off, he pushes to Faf at cover who flicks in back-handed flick. But Rahane was in
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, 1 run, flatter delivery outside off, Mitchell shuffles across his stumps early and knocks it towards cover for a quick single, even a quick pick-up and throw from Faf can't find Rahane short

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell, no run no run Ooh, some turn outside off. Mitchell is camped on the backfoot and defends towards cover
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, no run, shade fuller and just outside off, Mitchell plays back again as he knocks it towards cover, bit of bite and turn again

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell, no run no run Shimmies down the track but Dagar shortens the length and Mitchell has to defend
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, no run, length delivery on off-stump, saw the batter running down the track and dropped it just a touch shorter, just holds in the surface a touch too

commentary: Dagar to Mitchell, no run no run A tad short just outside off, he stays back and eases to backward point
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Mitchell, no run, length delivery outside off, punched straight to point

commentary: Dagar to Rahane,  1 run 1 run Length outside off, he pushes it through point for a run
second_commentary: Mayank Dagar to Rahane, 1 run, full outside off, just a touch early through his drive but it goes into the gap and through to sweeper cover

commentary: Karn to Ravindra, OUT OUT He's gone now! One shot too many for Rachin. Was a length ball on middle and leg. He sweeps eyeing another six, but doesn't connect as cleanly. Deep backward square leg settles himself and takes a comfortable catch. Lovely debut for Rachin who falls for a 15-ball 37. See all photos
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Ravindra, out Caught by Rajat Patidar!! Karn has his man now - was pushed through quicker and at the stumps, Ravindra went down on his knee as he looked to play the slog-sweep - hit it hard and hit it flat, straight down Patidar's throat at deep backward square leg. The dangerous Ravindra departs and RCB can heave a sigh of relief. Ravindra c Rajat Patidar b Karn Sharma 37(15) [4s-3 6s-3]

commentary: Karn to Ravindra,  SIX runs SIX runs Dropped short and he pumps it for six! On off stump, he rocks back and hammers him over deep midwicket fielder's head.
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Ravindra, SIX, a long hop and it's been hammered - dragged half-way by Karn, Ravindra rocks back and then thumps it powerfully over wide mid-wicket, there's a fielder in the deep, but he's well away from the ball

commentary: Karn to Rahane,  1 run 1 run Shimmies down the track to the length ball on leg stump and pushes to long on
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, Karn dragged the length back as Rahane came down the pitch, worked down to long-on for a single

commentary: Karn to Rahane, no run no run Flatter outside off, he stays back and punches to backward point
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Rahane, no run, pushed through by Karn - Rahane backs away and finds backward point with the cut

commentary: Karn to Rahane,  2 runs 2 runs Fuller in length on off and middle, he flicks it to deep midwicket and some excellent running get them a couple of runs
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Rahane, 2 runs, loopy delivery on middle and leg, clipped in front of square on the on-side and they race back for the second

commentary: Karn to Rahane, no run no run Flatter on the stumps, he goes back and pushes to the on side and Karn gets across
second_commentary: Karn Sharma to Rahane, no run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, worked off the back-foot to the bowler

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane,  3 runs 3 runs Fuller outside off, he digs it to backward point and sets off. The fielder throws down the stumps at the non-striker end, but Rahane is in. Also gets two extra runs via the ricochet
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, 3 runs, more runs, this is so frustrating for RCB - yorker length delivery and it was jammed in front of cover-point, the run was always there, but the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end, no one's backing him up and Rahane gets a couple of more runs in the bargain

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane,  2 runs 2 runs Juuuuust over Faf's head! Length ball outside off. He was looking  to go up and over mid-off, doesn't connect as well. Faf runs back, but can't get a hand on it
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, 2 runs, a mistimed drive, but the ball drops over Faf's right shoulder - fuller length delivery and just outside off, Rahane went hard on the drive, came off the thick edge and he's lucky to have cleared the infield

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane,  2 runs 2 runs Fuller in length well outside off. He opens his arms and drives aerially to the right of deep point
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, 2 runs, fuller length delivery and well wide of off - Rahane plays with a bent knee as he slices the drive over backward point, comes back for the second

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane,  SIX runs SIX runs Stand and deliver! Shot of the evening so far, for me. Back of a length ball outside off. He stands still and pumps him over mid-off and eventually the ropes for a 84m six
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, SIX, Rahane throws his hands on a length ball and sends it carving over mid-off for a maximum - back of a length and angling across the right-hander, he's smote it on the rise and the timing is sublime, into the stands at long-off

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run no run Very full and outside off, Rahane tries to squirt this fine. Makes no connection once more
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run, fuller length delivery and shaping across the right-hander - Rahane was looking to jam it out and missed

commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run no run Lovely bowling again from Dayal. Gets this on  a length angling away from Rahane, who is on the move while looking for a drive. Gets beaten.
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Rahane, no run, Dayal is bowling beautifrully to the right-handers, pitched up and the angle takes the ball away from Rahane's rteach, past the waft and into the gloves of the keeper

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, no run no run Raps him in the midriff at pace. Back of a length again on middle. Rachin looks to hack that away, but is beaten for pace
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, no run, short of a good length and around the off-stump channel, Ravindra swings and is struck high on the body

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra,  2 runs 2 runs Just short of Faf at mid-off. Was a back of a length ball outside off, he stands tall and slaps it hard but aerially. Faf dives forward, but the ball clearly fell short
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, 2 runs, just short of Faf at mid-off, and he then has to chase, does well to keep them down to a couple - back of a length and well wide of off, flat-batted uppishly towards mid-off and had faf diving forward on the catch

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra,  2 runs 2 runs Just short of Faf at mid-off. Was a back of a length ball outside off, he stands tall and slaps it hard but aerially. Faf dives forward, but the ball clearly fell short
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, wide, short and down leg, Ravindra was looking to help it on its way with the pull and missed, called as a wide

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, 1 wide 1 wide Back of a length ball down leg. He looks to help it away, can't connect but gets a wide. Rawat does well to his right
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, 2 runs, just short of Faf at mid-off, and he then has to chase, does well to keep them down to a couple - back of a length and well wide of off, flat-batted uppishly towards mid-off and had faf diving forward on the catch

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, 1 wide 1 wide Back of a length ball down leg. He looks to help it away, can't connect but gets a wide. Rawat does well to his right
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, wide, short and down leg, Ravindra was looking to help it on its way with the pull and missed, called as a wide

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Rahane,  1 run 1 run Back of a length ball outside off, he pats it to deep third
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Rahane runs it down towards third man for a single

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, no run no run Big shout for lbw but the umpire stays unmoved. No review taken. Length ball at 146kph that strikes Rahane on the pad. Think he got an inside-edge back onto the pad.
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Rahane, no run, a long LBW appeal, but they ain't reviewing it, must've been an inside edge, too close to dab and Rahane squeezed an under-edge onto his front-pad

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra,  1 run 1 run Length on off stump, he stays leg side of the ball and pushes to cover and sets off
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, 1 run, Alzarri shortens the length around off, punched to the left of cover-point for a single

commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra,  SIX runs SIX runs Hello there Mr Joseph says Rachin as he pulls him for six! Banged in short and on his hips, he helps it over fine leg with ease
second_commentary: Alzarri Joseph to Ravindra, SIX, cracking shot, pacy short ball from Alzarri - but this is at the hips of Ravindra, he swivels across anmd then hammers the pull over long leg for a maximum

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, OUT OUT Edged and taken on the second attempt by Green at first slip. This is excellent bowling and also excellent captaincy from Faf to keep the slip in. Keeps it on a length but well outside off stump. Gaikwad gets forward reaching for the drive. He gets a thick edge and Green takes a fairly simple catch albeit on the second attempt. Important wicket for RCB See all photos
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, out Caught by Green!! Edged and caught! Green on the second attempt and he has big hands, this is some reward for Dayal - troubled Gaikwad with the angle and has finally nailed him - pitched up and pushed across with the angle, Gaikwad had to reach out on the drive, there's no control over the shot and gets a thick edge to slip's right. Green was quick to react, but the ball popped out, fortunately for RCB - he's alert enough to grab the rebound off the knee. Gaikwad c Green b Yash Dayal 15(15) [4s-3]

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, FOUR runs FOUR runs Strayed on the pads and Gaikwad cashes in. Length down leg, he shuffles across and clips fine and for four. Six fours and six already in this innings
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, FOUR, wrong line from Dayal, short and at the pads - Gaikwad gets inside the line and nudged it very fine, beats the man in the ring and runs away

commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra,  1 run 1 run He's timing these really well so far. That was on a good length outside off, he stands tall and slaps it to mid-off
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, driven to the right of mid-off for a single

commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, no run no run A hint of shape away from Dayal on that length ball outside off, he prods forward and punches it nicely but straight to cover point
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Ravindra leans across and defends it with an open face to cover-point

commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, FOUR runs FOUR runs SHOT! Fuller-length ball but was veering down leg. He flicks it with authority past short fine leg
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, FOUR, more runs, too full and too straight from Dayal - on the pads and it's whipped away backward of square on the on-side, beats the man in the ring and races away

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad,  1 run 1 run Length ball angling away from Gaikwad outside off. He pushes at it with an open face of the bat to deep third
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, Gaikwad plays with an angled bat and runs it backward of square on the off-side for a single

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra,  SIX runs SIX runs Top edge for six! Rachin is enjoying a bit of luck on IPL debut. A well-directed short of a length ball aimed at his body. Rachin swivel-pulls gets a big top edge that goes over short fine leg and just over the ropes
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, SIX, top-edge and six, luck running Ravindra's way at the moment - banged in short and he's late on the pull, gets a massive top-edge, was always a safe shot with fine leg inside the ring, this one has enough power to sail over the ropes

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad,  1 run 1 run back of a length ball outside off, he gets across and slaps it to deep point
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, 1 run, short of a good length and well wide of off, chopped to the left of cover-point for a single

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra,  1 run 1 run Fuller in length on middle and leg, he punches it neatly but straight to mid-on
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, driven to the left of mid-on and they're off for a quick single

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad,  1 run 1 run Another excellent stop from Dagar. This time at cover. Was fuller in length outside off, he leans into the cover drive but Dagar dives full-length to his right to save three
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, 1 run, Mayank has saved a few more runs here - fuller length delivery and well wide of off, driven to the right of cover where he threw himself and made a one-handed save

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra,  1 run 1 run Chipped just over the bowler's head. Was a length ball on middle, he was looking to clip it but closed the face of the bat early. The leading edge just evades the bowler
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, 1 run, Ravindra gets lucky now - on a good length and angling back into the left-hander, Ravindra was early into the tuck, closed the bat-face and the leading edghe popped over Siraj's outstretched right-hand

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR runs FOUR runs Flicked for four! That's a lovely wristy flick from Rachin. Was a length ball on his pads, he sends it all across the carpet and deep backward square leg can't do much
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR, beautifully played, fuller length delivery and angling into the pads, Ravindra lets the ball come, brings his wrists into play and then flicks it backward of square on the on-side, beat the despairing dive from the fielder in the deep

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR runs FOUR runs Flicked for four! That's a lovely wristy flick from Rachin. Was a length ball on his pads, he sends it all across the carpet and deep backward square leg can't do much
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, wide, Siraj loses his line and spills one well down the leg-side, called as a wide

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, 1 wide 1 wide Full but sprays it down leg. Rawat does well to his right. Called a wide
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, FOUR, beautifully played, fuller length delivery and angling into the pads, Ravindra lets the ball come, brings his wrists into play and then flicks it backward of square on the on-side, beat the despairing dive from the fielder in the deep

commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, 1 wide 1 wide Full but sprays it down leg. Rawat does well to his right. Called a wide
second_commentary: Siraj to Ravindra, wide, Siraj loses his line and spills one well down the leg-side, called as a wide

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run no run Goes past the outside edge for a third straight time. Changes the length again. Was back of a length outside off. Gaikwad throws his hands at it looking for a swish, gets beaten
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, beaten, short of a good length and angling across the right-hander, brings out a loose waft and Gaikwad's beaten on the outside edge

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run no run And again! Pushes the fuller and angling away from Gaikwad inviting him for a drive. He takes the bait but only connects at thin air
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, much better from Yash - pitched up and pushed across with the natural angle, dragged Gaikwad into the drive and beats him on the outside edge

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run no run Ooh, close. Good length ball outside off with a hint of away shape. Gaikwad nibbles at it and gets beaten
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, lovely delivery, short of a good length and a hint of shape away from off, Gaikwad has a poke at that and nearly edges it through to the keeper

commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run no run Fails to get a decent connection on that. Length ball on Gaikwad's pads, he gets across and clip but can't beat fine leg
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Gaikwad, no run, back of a length and at the hips, tucked straight to the fielder at short fine

commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra,  1 run 1 run Fuller in length on middle and leg, he clips past mid-on for a run
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, 1 run, on a good length and angling into the left-hander, worked in front of square on the on-side, to the left of mid-on for a single

commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, FOUR runs FOUR runs Gets an inside-edge for four! Beginners luck for Rachin. Was a length ball outside off, he looks to flay it away through the off side, gets a thick inside edge just past off stump and past the keeper's right
second_commentary: Yash Dayal to Ravindra, FOUR, streaky and four, fuller length delivery and holding its line outside off - Ravindra goes hard on the drive, gets a big inside edge that runs away past the stumps and away from Rawat's reach

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run no run Back of a length ball outside off. He plays inside the line of the ball and is beaten. Rawat is hit on the knee with the ball going to him on the half-volley
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run, on a good length and holding its line outside off - stayed very low and burst under Gaikwad's bat, bouncing through to the keepert

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, FOUR runs FOUR runs In the air but in the gap. That was close. Was a length ball floated well outside off. He opens the face of the blade and drives aerially between backward point and point. Picked the gap to perfection
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, FOUR, uppish and four, fuller length delivery and shaping away from wide of off, Gaikwad is lured into the drive, he doesn't get on top of the bounce, but does manage to find the gap square past cover-point

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run no run Length ball tailing away from Gaikwad well outside off. He leaves it alone
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run, on a good length and shaping away from outside off - Gaikwad covers the line, lifts his bat and lets it go

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run no run Lovely timing and even better fielding at backward point. Back of a length ball outside off. The width was the key. He cuts it hard but Dagar flings to his right and saves a certain four
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run, back of a length and well wide of off, punched to the right of backward point where Mayank Dagar makes an acrobatic stop, saved a certain boundary

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run no run Play and a miss now. Back of a length ball shaping away from Gaikwad, who has a swish at it but doesn't connect. Rawat collects on the bounce
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, no run, short of a good length and angling adcross the right-hander, stays a fraction low and goes under Gaikwad's poke, bounced through to the keeper

commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, FOUR runs FOUR runs BANG! Short ball outside off, he swivels and pull over square leg with minimum of fuss. That's some way to start your IPL.
second_commentary: Siraj to Gaikwad, FOUR, cracking shot, Ruturaj is off and running - friendly short ball from Siraj, shoulders arms up to the right-hander, Gaikwad swivels across and then hammers the pull over square leg for a boundary
